subsection.name: Extreme Programming with Ant
subsection.p: This book shows how to implement an XP project using Ant 1.5.3, and many other 3rd party tools. Covers:

ul.li: The fundamentals of Ant: concepts, core and optional tasks
How to write custom Ant components, including custom Tasks, Loggers, Listeners, Input Handlers, Selectors, Filters, Mappers and Data Types
Mitigating risks by creating spike tests with Ant buildfiles
Add CVS version control and testing with JUnit
Enforcing Code Standards with Jalopy, PMD, CheckStyle, iContract, JDepend
Adapting an XP process for use by other teams or across an enterprise
Custom Task examples to generating UML diagrams, creating reports and metrics on-the-fly
Follows a case-study of a team that implements an XP Project

subsection.source: Das Build-Tool Ant ist das Open-Source-Werkzeug, das den Entwicklungsprozess einer Java- oder J2EE-Anwendung wesentlich vereinfacht. Gesteuert durch XML-basierte Skripte fï¿½hrt es nahezu alle Aufgaben aus, die nach dem Kodieren einer Anwendung anfallen.

Using and writing

subsection.p: Covers Ant release 1.4.1.

subsection.name: Ant. Kurz und Gut.
subsection.p: A German language short reference for Ant that covers Ant 1.4. This is the original description:
subsection.source: Ant kurz & gut enthält eine vollständige Referenz der Built-in Tasks und ihrer jeweiligen Attribute sowie kurze Beispiele für ihre Verwendung. Daneben bietet das Buch eine knappe Einführung in die Arbeit mit Ant und eine Erläuterung der Ant-Basiselemente (Projekte, Properties, Targets und Tasks). Behandelt werden außerdem grundlegende Konzepte wie Filesets, Patternsets und Pfadstrukturen, das Schreiben eigener Tasks, die Aufruf-Syntax und Optional Tasks.

subsection.name: Java Tools for eXtreme Programming
subsection.p: This book covers the following XP subjects:

ul.li: Continuous integration through build and deployment automation
The value of refactoring and continuous integration
How Ant, JUnit, JUnitPerf, Cactus, HTTPUnit, and JMeter can be used to achieve the goals of the XP methodology

section.name: Articles and Presentations
section.p: The following sections list articles and presentations written about Apache Ant. If you've written something that should be included, please post it to one of the mailing lists.

subsection.name: Ant in Anger: Using Ant in a Production Development System
subsection.p: This document describes strategies and some basic examples of how to use Ant in larger team development projects.

subsection.name: Ant Task Guidelines
subsection.p: This document describes how to write custom Ant tasks, and how to submit them to potentially be included in Ant.

subsection.name: Build a Better Robot with Ant
subsection.p: This article describes the gory details of writing custom Ant tasks.

subsection.name: Automating the build and test process
subsection.p: This article demonstrates an approach to the automated build and test process. Working with Ant 1.3 and the JUnit test framework, it shows how to automate a process that captures pertinent information about each test suite run, generates an attractive report, and e-mails the report.

subsection.name: Incremental development with Ant and JUnit
subsection.p: This article explores the benefits of unit testing with Ant and JUnit, detailing how to develop automated unit tests and integrate them into your build process.

subsection.name: Automate your build process using Java and Ant
subsection.p: This article provides an introduction to using Ant with some basic examples and by highlighting some of the important tasks.

subsection.name: Short tutorial in Cactus' (formerly J2EEUnit) documentation
subsection.p: There is a short tutorial on how to use Ant in Cactus' documentation. It has a slant towards build files that will be used with Cactus.

subsection.name: Developing custom Ant tasks with VisualAge for Java
subsection.p: This article outlines how to integrate Ant into VisualAge for Java, and how to write and debug custom tasks using the IDE and the integrated debugger.

subsection.name: Automated builds with VisualAge for Java and Ant
subsection.p: This article shows how you can perform command line builds with a VisualAge for Java repository.

subsection.name: Ant: A Build Tool from the Jakarta Project
subsection.p: This article is from the "Best Practices" section of Sun's Dot-Com Builder Site.

subsection.name: Making a Mountain Out of an Anthill
subsection.p: This article is from the June 2001 issue of the Java Developer' Journal. You need to be a registered JDJ subscriber to view this article.

subsection.name: Using Ant and Weblogic EJBs
subsection.p: This article describes how to use Ant to create Weblogic EJBs, and some workarounds for issues you may encounter.

subsection.name: Using JavaScript with Ant
subsection.p: A tutorial about using JavaScript and XSLT with Ant.

subsection.name: Building with Ant
subsection.p: Series of articles that describe a framework for web application development based on Ant and JUnit.
